title: Congress to place legal teams in every district; they will be our eyes and ears: Singhvi
content: The Congress will also constitute a ‘Rapid response force’ of leading lawyers in each State. These teams will be tasked with promptly taking court cases involving the party

title: Centre seeks public comments on draft Pesticides Management Bill to replace 1968 Act
content: The legislation aims to replace the 57-year-old Insecticides Act, 1968, and the Insecticides Rules, 1971, with enhanced penalties for violations.

title: State govt. shares High Court’s satisfaction with SIT probe, says Vasavan
content: On the SIT quizzing former Devaswom Minister Kadakampally Surendran, the Devaswom Minister said the SIT was free to summon or question anyone as part its probe

title: X tells IT Ministry it is ‘in compliance’ with Indian law
content: The social media platform has been scrutinised by the government after its Grok chatbot publicly generated non-consensual sexualised pictures of women

title: Writers cannot stay neutral in times of intolerance, says Kerala Chief Minister
content: Pinarayi and V.D. Satheesan voice their opposition to U.S. attack on Venezuela at the inaugural function of the Kerala Legislature International Book Festival. Legislative Assembly’s award for contributions to literature handed over to writer N.S. Madhavan

title: Over 50 posts vacant in PCB, says report
content: Of the total vacant seats, 19 are in the scientific category; 11 in the engineering wing; and 23 in the administration section

title: Nation must emulate Malappuram’s communal harmony, says Kanthapuram
content: Anyone who has visited the district even once will understand the reality: the warmth and spirit of coexistence of its people,” he says, urging society to salute and adopt the positive examples of the district rather than disparage its people

title: Arrangements in place for Flamingo Festival in Tirupati
content: The event is set to be held at Pulicat Bird Sanctuary in Sullurpeta constituency on January 10 and 11

title: Form special cell to deal with black magic, HC tells govt.
content: Division Bench of Chief Justice Nitin Jamdar and Justice Syam Kumar V.M. suggests this while hearing a public interest litigation  filed by the Kerala Yukthivadi Sangham seeking a legislation similar to those enacted in Maharashtra and Karnataka to prohibit such harmful rituals

title: CM announces superspeciality hospital for Haveri
content: He was addressing a gathering after inaugurating the building of Haveri Institute of Medical Sciences and various development works

title: Thrissur gears up for State School Arts Festival with tight security and anti-drug campaign
content: Over 1,000 police personnel, 200 surveillance cameras, and volunteer forces to be deployed; gold cup tour begins from Kasaragod

title: Karnataka to expand menstrual cup distribution as part of sustainable hygiene push
content: As per the government order, menstrual cups will be introduced only for students from Classes 9 to 12, while sanitary napkins will continue to be provided to students from Classes 6 to 8

title: Blowout in Mori-5 well a geological surprise, says ONGC official
content: The well has pure natural gas and there is no deposit of oil, and the estimations of natural gas reservoir and its flow may have been underestimated, says National Crisis Management Team Head Srihari

title: All eligible families in Kerala will be ensured ration cards: Minister G.R. Anil
content: Minister inaugurates State-level distribution of Antyodaya Anna Yojana ration cards for 7,000 families

title: Census 2027: Houselisting operations to take place between April 1-September 30 across all States, UTs
content: Houselisting operations will be conducted between April 1, 2026 and September 30, 2026 across all States and Union Territories

title: CM approves recruitment of staff for Piduguralla medical college
content: He gives the nod to recruit 237 doctors and other health staff for the medical college and 600 staffers for the teaching hospital

title: DPR work starts for proposed Bengaluru–Tumakuru metro line
content: BMRCL has awarded a contract for preparing the DPR to Aarvee Engineering Consultants, which will prepare the report at a cost exceeding ₹1.2 crore

title: Error-free NRC can ensure clean polls in Assam: AASU
content: No election in Assam has been conducted with a genuinely verified voter list, says the All Assam Students’ Union’s adviser Samujjal Bhattacharya

title: After Delcy Rodriguez takes oath, Jairam Ramesh recalls her India links
content: The Congress leader draws attention to a meeting in August 2023 between Ms. Rodriguez and India’s then Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar

title: Recon-2026 in Hubballi from tomorrow
content: The three-day mega exposition of realty, interiors and construction material is being seen as North Karnataka’s largest exposition

title: Andhra Pradesh’s growth model a source of inspiration, says Mauritius President Dharambeer Gokhool
content: The State stands out for harmoniously blending cultural heritage, civilisational values and modern technology, he observes

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: SIR 2.0: Nearly 6.5 crore electors removed from draft rolls of nine States, three UTs
content: The nine States and three UTs had 50.9 crore electors before phase two SIR, which commenced on October 27, 2025

title: Short stories collection, Halahalla, released in Dharwad
content: The author, Basavaraj Donur, is the Head of the Department of English at Central University of Karnataka in Kalaburagi

title: Pawan calls for efforts to increase green cover in A.P. to 50% by 2047
content: Plans are afoot to develop a ‘Great Green Wall of A.P.’ comprising mangroves and shelterbelts along the coast to withstand climate-induced risks, he says

title: Both women and men with covered faces cannot buy gold, silver in Bihar, says jewellers’ body
content: Jewellery shops in Bihar may refuse entry and sale to customers with their faces covered in hijabs, naqabs, burqas (veils), scarves, masks, helmets, etc., the federation said.

title: ‘Businessmen from MP with mining permits facing threats from local leaders in Annamayya district’
content: It is causing irreparable loss to the businessmen, Mandla MP Faggan Singh Kulaste tells Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan

title: ED attaches ₹400 crore assets in Jaypee group homebuyers’ case
content: Properties linked to Jaypee Infratech and Jayprakash Associates attached over alleged diversion of funds

title: ‘Prima facie’ not with Justice Varma, Supreme Court says
content: Supreme Court Bench disagrees with the judge’s claim that the Lok Sabha Speaker should not have “unilaterally” constituted an inquiry committee after the RS Deputy Chairman rejected a motion to remove him

title: Congress leader slams Telangana for plea in apex court on Polavaram project
content: Approaching the Supreme Court seeking a halt to the project is against the spirit of the decisions taken at the time of bifurcation, says Kolanukonda Shivaji

title: BJP, Congress spar over Nehru’s role in Somnath temple reconstruction
content: The saffron party accused the former Prime Minister of “appeasement politics” and the Opposition rejecting the charge as being based on “lies and half-truths”

title: Ill Or Missing Mate? Kolkata Zoo Hippo Refuses To Leave Water For 14 Days
content: A young hippopotamus at Kolkata's Alipore Zoo has refused to leave its water enclosure for the last 14 days amid a citywide cold wave.

title: "Celebrate With Fireworks": Omar Abdullah's Attack After Medical College Shuts
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah has criticised the Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Sangharsh Samiti's celebration over the National Medical Commission's decision to revoke recognition of the Mata Vaishno Devi Medical College.

title: Denied CAPF Post Because Of Tattoos, Man Gets Them Removed, Is Rejected Again
content: Tattoos on multiple parts of his body have led to an aspirant being rejected for a post in the Central Armed Police Forces despite undergoing a procedure to remove them.

title: Engineer, 26, Falls From 16th Floor Of Building In Bengaluru, Dies
content: A 26-year-old, who had finished his education in electronic engineering in Europe and had returned to India recently to start working, died after falling from the 16th floor of a building in Bengaluru.

title: Flag Paint, Name Change, Russian Request: What Oil Tanker Did To Escape US
content: The oil tanker now known as Marinera was seized by the United States on Wednesday in the North Atlantic after a dramatic pursuit lasting more than two weeks.

title: "Roads Should Be Clear Of Dogs And Stray Animals": Top Court To Civic Bodies
content: Flagging non-compliances of rules and directions by civic bodies, the Supreme Court on Wednesday said that people were dying not only due to dog bites alone in the country but also because of accidents caused by stray animals on roads.

title: 2-Year-Old Burnt To Death In House Fire In UP
content: A two-year-old girl died in a fire that broke out in her house in the Bakewar area of Etawah district on Wednesday, police said.

title: 'Foolishly Did Not Give Me Nobel': Trump Attacks Norway Over 'Ending' 8 Wars
content: In scathing criticism on Truth Social, US President Donald Trump targeted NATO nations after Denmark warned that an attack by America would mean the end of NATO.

title: Shiv Sena Candidate Stabbed During Mumbai Civic Body Elections Campaign
content: Political tensions have escalated sharply in the run-up to the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections as a shocking act of violence was reported from Mumbai on Wednesday.

title: US Forces Seize Russia-Flagged Oil Tanker In Atlantic After Dramatic Chase
content: The United States has begun a high-stakes effort to seize a Russian-flagged oil tanker in the North Sea after pursuing the vessel for more than two weeks.

title: MGR To Vijay: Tamil Nadu's Changing Equation With Actor-Politicians
content: As Tamil Nadu gears up for the 2026 assembly elections, the highly charged atmosphere in the state is marked more by quiet mobilisation and narrative positioning than by loud campaign rhetoric - for now.

title: Madhya Pradesh Artisans Allege Fraud After 'Fake' Stole Gifted To JP Nadda
content: The row broke out after Chief Minister Mohan Yadav presented a Bagh print stole to Union Health Minister JP Nadda during a public programme in Dhar.

title: Narrow Escape For MK Stalin As His Vehicle's Tyre Burst On Way To Airport
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin had a narrow escape on Tuesday when a vehicle in which he was travelling suffered a tyre burst while returning to the Madurai airport after attending a government function in Dindigul district.

title: Russia Offered US A Secret Deal To Swap Venezuela For Ukraine In 2019
content: Russian officials indicated in 2019 that the Kremlin would be willing to back off from its support for Nicolas Maduro in Venezuela in exchange for a free hand in Ukraine, according to Fiona Hill, an adviser to President Donald Trump at the time.

title: 'Won't Get Into Numbers': Chief Minister Amid Confusion Over Indore Deaths
content: Deaths resulting from the consumption of contaminated drinking water in Indore continued to rise on Wednesday, with local records and families putting the number at 20, even as the Madhya Pradesh government has officially acknowledged four deaths.

title: 2 Sandalwood Trees Worth Lakhs Stolen From Kerala Police Academy
content: Thieves managed to pull off a daring theft from one of the most heavily guarded locations in Kerala, stealing two sandalwood trees from the Kerala Police Academy campus in Thrissur district.

title: 150 Jets, Delta Force, CIA: How US Captured Maduro In Abbottabad-Like Raid
content: In its most complex raid since Abbottabad, when the US military killed al-Qaeda leader Osama bin Laden, the United States captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores.

title: "Will Remain In Politics Until I Have People's Blessings": Siddaramaiah
content: Siddaramaiah, who on Wednesday etched his name in history as the longest serving Chief Minister of Karnataka said he has come so far in politics with the blessings of the people and doesn't know how long he will be active.

title: Lawrence Bishnoi Gang Member Brought To India After Deportation From US
content: The CBI, in coordination with the Ministry of External Affairs and the Ministry of Home Affairs, has successfully facilitated the return of wanted fugitive Aman alias Aman Kumar alias Aman Bhainswal from the United States to India.

title: From Atlantic to Caribbean: US seizes 2 Venezuela-linked oil tankers; 'blockade' in full effect
content: American forces seized a Russian-flagged oil tanker linked to Venezuela after a lengthy pursuit. The vessel, previously sanctioned for smuggling for Hezbollah, attempted to evade a US blockade. Despite claims of Russian protection, the US considers the ship stateless, marking the second such seizure by American forces in the Caribbean.

title: Watch: Helicopters & armed troops — US boards two 'Ghost Fleet' tankers
content: The US Coast Guard successfully boarded two "ghost fleet" tankers, the Motor Tanker Bella I and Motor Tanker Sophia, in coordinated predawn operations. Both vessels had ties to Venezuela, with one attempting to evade pursuit for weeks. Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem vowed to disrupt narco-terrorism funding and protect Americans.

title: UP teen kidnapped, gang-raped by cop, his friend on railway track; dumped outside her home
content: A 14-year-old girl was allegedly kidnapped and gang-raped by a policeman and his friend in Kanpur. The perpetrators sexually abused her for two hours before abandoning her near her home. The family faced initial difficulties in filing a complaint due to one accused being a police officer.

title: US seizes Russia-flagged ship: Oil tanker linked to Venezuela; Moscow warship nearby
content: The US Coast Guard and military attempted to seize a Russian-flagged oil tanker linked to Venezuela after a lengthy pursuit, with Russian naval vessels nearby. This operation, targeting a vessel that evaded previous US boarding efforts, marks a significant escalation in enforcing sanctions against Venezuela, occurring shortly after a US raid in Caracas.

title: Sooryavanshi takes Player of the Match and Series; Ind U19 crush SA by 233 runs
content: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi and Aaron George starred with centuries as India U-19 thrashed South Africa by 233 runs to complete a 3-0 series whitewash. Sooryavanshi's 127 and George's 118 powered India to 393, a target South Africa couldn't chase, ending at 160. Sooryavanshi was named Player of the Match and Series.

title: CEO Jensen Huang confirms, Nvidia’s $500 billion AI demand outlook won't …
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang confirmed a $500 billion AI demand outlook, reflecting locked-in business for 2025-2026, with potential for upside. This figure includes Blackwell GPUs, upcoming Vera Rubin chips, and related systems. The CFO noted the visibility has already grown, with customers securing orders for next-generation platforms, driven partly by the rise of open-source AI models.

title: Got 'free advice' during Op Sindoor: EAM targets West's hypocrisy; what he said on Venezuela
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar criticised western nations for offering unsolicited advice urging them to "look at their own region for levels of violence". He emphasised India's independent approach to international relations, dealing with partners and adversaries differently. Jaishankar also highlighted India's concern for safety of the people of Venezuela amidst crisis.

title: 'Russia, China only fear ...': Trump blasts Nato; takes credit for pushing bloc to pay 'bills'
content: US President Donald Trump asserted that NATO allies significantly boosted defense spending only after his direct intervention, claiming they now contribute more and that Russia and China wouldn't fear the alliance without U.S. backing. He also stated his actions prevented Russia from taking all of Ukraine and ended numerous conflicts, saving millions of lives.

title: Apple execs won't leave South Korea: Hunting Samsung, SK Hynix supply; iPhone RAM at risk
content: Tech giants, including Apple, are reportedly camping out in South Korean hotels to secure crucial memory chip supplies.  A global shortage, driven by AI demand, has sent RAM prices soaring, forcing companies to negotiate long-term contracts.  This situation could lead to higher iPhone prices or reduced memory in future models.

title: Not Gill! Australian great picks this India player as next Test superstar
content: Cricket's next generation is stepping into the spotlight as legends near retirement.  Australian great Mark Waugh has tipped Indian prodigy Yashasvi Jaiswal as the future Test superstar, citing his impressive early career stats.  Meanwhile, former England captain Michael Vaughan champions England's Harry Brook for the same honour, highlighting his exciting potential. Both experts agree the game's future is bright.

title: B'desh to resume flights to Pak after 10-yr gap; has India given clearance?
content: Biman Bangladesh Airlines is set to resume direct flights between Dhaka and Karachi on January 29, ending a decade-long hiatus. Initially operating twice weekly, the service aims to boost travel and business ties. This development follows improving diplomatic relations between Bangladesh and Pakistan, though overflight permission from India remains unconfirmed.

title: Forever layoff: A rising trend turning workplaces into waiting rooms
content: Forever layoff captures a quiet shift in modern work: Layoffs that never end, only repeat. Through Dickens’s fact-driven Coketown and Kafka’s unfinished trial, this analysis traces how endless uncertainty reshapes mindspace, productivity, trust, and power at work. Jobs remain, but assurance disappears. Careers no longer progress or conclude. They linger, alert, provisional, and permanently under review.

title: Musk says he's impressed with China; highlights its rapid EV & solar growth
content: Elon Musk humorously noted China's rapid adoption of his energy suggestions, including massive battery, EV, and solar production. He emphasized batteries as key to increasing energy output, citing Tesla's Megapacks and the new Megablock as solutions for grid stability and AI-driven power demands.

title: Did Vicky Kaushal name his son after his character in 'Uri: The Surgical Strike'?
content: Vicky Kaushal and Katrina Kaif have revealed their son's name, Vihaan Kaushal, two months after his birth on November 7, 2025. Fans speculate the name is a nod to Vicky's character in 'Uri: The Surgical Strike'. The couple shared the news on Instagram, calling their son their 'Ray of Light'.

title: 'Unacceptable': Dhawan condemns 'brutal assault on a Hindu widow in Bangladesh'
content: Shikhar Dhawan condemned the brutal assault on a Hindu widow in Bangladesh, calling the violence unacceptable. Rising attacks on minorities have strained India-Bangladesh cricket ties, leading to Mustafizur Rahman’s IPL exit and BCB seeking to move T20 World Cup matches from India. The ICC has assured cooperation with the BCB to address security concerns and ensure Bangladesh’s smooth participation.

title: Travis Kelce reaches breaking point as Taylor Swift hits new career
content: As the Chiefs wrapped up a disappointing season, Travis Kelce faced mounting questions about his NFL future and the possibility of retirement. At the same time, Taylor Swift reached another career high, extending her historic run atop the Billboard 200. The contrast highlighted a pivotal moment for the high-profile couple, with one career pausing as the other surged forward.

title: Tommy Fleetwood and Clare Fleetwood’s net worth: Golf earnings, family, fortune
content: Tommy and Clare Fleetwood have built a significant fortune through Tommy's successful golf career, prize money, and lucrative brand deals. Clare, as his manager, plays a crucial role in their financial success and their private family life. Their collaborative approach has led to both on-course achievements and long-term financial stability.

title: Haydn Fleury hospitalized after scary first-period hit vs Golden Knights
content: Winnipeg Jets defenseman Haydn Fleury was stretchered off and hospitalized after a frightening first-period collision with Golden Knights forward Keegan Kolesar. Fleury crashed hard into the end boards while attempting a zone clear. He suffered a broken nose and additional head, neck, and back injuries, with tests ongoing following Winnipeg’s overtime loss to Vegas.

title: Kapil Sharma charges Rs 5 crore per episode; here is what others earn
content: Kapil Sharma's new show season is a hit, with Priyanka Chopra gracing the premiere and Sunil Grover's Aamir Khan mimicry going viral. Reports reveal the comedians' fees: Kapil reportedly earns Rs 5 crore per episode, while Sunil Grover is paid Rs 25 lakh. Krushna Abhishek and Archana Puran Singh also command significant per-episode earnings.

title: 'ICC does not understand the situation': B'desh escalate T20 WC row
content: Bangladesh's Youth and Sports Adviser Asif Nazrul expressed disappointment with the ICC's response to security concerns for their T20 World Cup matches in India. He cited Mustafizur Rahman's IPL release as evidence of an unsafe environment, demanding matches be moved to Sri Lanka. Nazrul stressed no compromise on player security and national dignity.

title: Australia issues travel advisory; urges citizens to exit Iran amid violent protests
content: Australia has urged its citizens to leave Iran immediately due to violent protests and a volatile security situation. The ongoing demonstrations, sparked by economic grievances, have led to significant casualties among protesters and security forces. President Pezeshkian has ordered security forces not to crack down on economic protests, distinguishing them from rioters.

title: Ashes | Catching Tendulkar’s unfathomable 15,921: Root is on his way
content: Joe Root has begun 2026 with a century, his second of the ongoing Ashes in Australia. The 35-year-old needs another 1,978 runs to surpass Sachin Tendulkar’s long-standing record of 15,921 Test runs, achieved across 329 innings and 200 Tests. Root has so far amassed 13,943 runs from 298 innings in 163 Tests.

title: Why are you seeing names flashing for calls from unknown numbers?
content: India's telecom sector is rolling out Calling Name Presentation (CNAP), a new feature displaying registered caller names on incoming calls. This initiative, driven by DOT and TRAI, aims to combat rising spam and fraud by enhancing caller identification. The nationwide rollout for 4G and 5G networks is expected by March 31, 2026.

title: Scenes of frenzy: Virat Kohli gets mobbed on arrival in Vadodara - Watch
content: Virat Kohli's arrival in Vadodara for the ODI series against New Zealand sparked a frenzy, with fans overwhelming the airport. Despite the chaotic reception, Kohli, in stellar ODI form after recent centuries, heads into the series brimming with confidence. His consistent performances have made him a sought-after figure, drawing massive crowds wherever he appears.

title: How an alcoholic became Russia's biggest CIA asset
content: ​To understand Aldrich Ames, one must first strip away the mythology that usually attaches itself to traitors. He was not glamorous, not especially clever, not driven by grand visions of history. He was, above all else, familiar. A second-generation CIA man who grew up inside the culture of secrecy, hierarchy, and quiet entitlement that defined Cold War intelligence work.

title: How Maduro's 'guru' Sri Sathya Sai Baba became a household name in Venezuela
content: Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro's courtroom invocation of God reveals a deep devotion to Indian guru Sri Sathya Sai Baba, revered as a "man of miracles." Maduro and other Venezuelan politicians were followers, with Sai Baba's portrait displayed in the presidential palace.  The guru's teachings of "love all, serve all" resonated widely, even amidst accusations of misconduct.

title: Are Indian finance degrees keeping up with global standards? An expert explains
content: Indian universities are enhancing finance education, but a gap persists between domestic degrees and global workplace expectations. Experts highlight a need to shift from theory to practical application, integrate international financial contexts, and embed digital technologies. While progress is evident, structural changes are crucial for Indian finance education to truly compete globally.

title: Faridabad: British Airways staff thrashed after scuffle, cab driver stabbed; 4 arrested
content: Two British Airways employees and their driver were attacked near Old Chowk in Faridabad. The incident began when a motorcycle zipped too close, running over one employee's foot. When confronted, the riders allegedly assaulted the employees and stabbed the driver in the stomach. Four daily wagers were arrested in connection with the attack.

title: From $13mn to $8.4b: San Francisco 49ers owner York family net worth
content: Forbes ranks San Francisco 49ers owner Denise DeBartolo York and her family at $8.4 Billion, placing them ahead of Donald Trump and Mark Cuban. The York family controls over 90% of the 49ers, now valued above $8 Billion, after decades of growth tied to NFL success and global sports investments, according to Forbes 2025 rankings released in September this year.

title: Breaking US laws could cost you your student visa, US embassy warns
content: The US Embassy in India has issued a stern warning to students, emphasizing that visa cancellations, deportation, and future travel bans can result from violating US laws. This advisory underscores that a US visa is a privilege contingent on continuous compliance with American regulations, especially with enhanced immigration enforcement and biometric screening now in place.

title: T20 WC: ICC forces Bangladesh to play in India? BCB breaks silence
content: BCB president Aminul Islam Bulbul has denied reports that the ICC forced Bangladesh to play all T20 World Cup matches in India, calling them false. He said security concerns remain the board’s priority and government guidance is required. Bulbul confirmed talks with the ICC, which has shown willingness to cooperate, but Bangladesh will stay firm if safety issues persist.

title: Another Hindu man dies in Bangladesh: Youth drowns in canal; was being chased by mob
content: A Hindu youth, Mithun Sarkar, tragically drowned in Bangladesh after being chased by a mob accusing him of theft. This incident in Naogaon district highlights a disturbing surge in communal violence, with over 50 incidents reported in December alone, including murders, land grabs, and assaults. Authorities are investigating Sarkar's death amidst ongoing unrest.

title: Why there's nothing special about Trump's Greenland threat
content: America's rise to global dominance was a deliberate and aggressive process, not an overnight occurrence. Through a combination of inheritance, war, purchases, and ideological expansion, the United States systematically grew its territory and influence. This relentless pursuit of grandeur, evident from its colonial beginnings to its modern-day ambitions, forged the nation into the powerful entity it is today.

title: ‘It's not baigan’: TMC mocks sports minister Mandaviya over Mohun Bagan faux pas
content: Union sports minister Mansukh Mandaviya's mispronunciation of Kolkata football club Mohun Bagan drew sharp criticism from the ruling Trinamool Congress. The TMC accused the BJP of showing contempt for Bengal by mangling the names of revered football institutions, calling them symbols of identity and pride. The party slammed the BJP's alleged "Bangla-Birodhi arrogance".

title: 'The 1am op': How demolition drive at Delhi mosque spiralled into chaos - key points
content: A demolition drive by the Municipal Corporation of Delhi near Faiz-e-Ilahi Mosque turned tense as stone-pelting injured police personnel. Authorities registered an FIR and detained individuals, with investigations ongoing using CCTV footage. The operation, ordered by the High Court to remove unauthorized constructions, proceeded with heavy machinery and security.

title: IND vs NZ: 'If you're not from Mumbai'- Gaikwad's ODI squad snub stirs fresh debate
content: Ruturaj Gaikwad's omission from India's New Zealand squad, despite a recent century, has sparked debate. Former player Robin Uthappa expressed bewilderment, highlighting the mental strain on players in Indian cricket's 'survival mode.' He emphasized the need for resilience and persistence, especially for those not from traditional cricketing hubs, to navigate selection challenges.

title: 'Not only dog bites': SC flags road accidents due to strays; highlights civic lapses
content: The Supreme Court has flagged civic authorities' lapses, noting that stray animals on roads, not just dog bites, are causing fatalities and accidents. Justices emphasized strict implementation of rules for stray animal management, highlighting the danger posed by roaming animals. The court warned of harsh action against non-compliant states, stressing the need for scientific solutions like the CSVR model.

title: Robust economy! India's GDP growth projected at 7.4% in FY26 - govt releases estimates
content: ​India's economy will grow at a robust 7.4% in the financial year 2025-26, according to the first advanced estimates of Gross Domestic Product released by the National Statistics Office (NSO). This is much higher than the 6.5% growth in the previous financial year.

title: Unholy alliance? BJP, Cong units tie up for Maha civic body polls; face fire from leadership
content: In Ambernath, the Congress suspended its corporators and block president for aligning with the BJP-led Ambernath Vikas Aghadi to form the civic administration, sidelining the Shiv Sena. This rare local alliance between rivals occurred despite the Shiv Sena emerging as the single largest party in the municipal elections.

title: Explained: Why NMC shut down the MBBS course at Vaishno Devi medical college in J&K
content: The National Medical Commission withdrew approval for the MBBS course at Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Institute of Medical Excellence after a surprise inspection found serious deficiencies in faculty, infrastructure and clinical exposure. Despite political protests over student composition, the shutdown was based on regulatory non-compliance. Existing students will be relocated to other medical colleges as supernumerary seats.

title: ‘Mediator for peace’: S Korea seeks China’s help to ease tensions with N Korea
content: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung has requested Chinese President Xi Jinping to mediate the North Korean nuclear crisis and ease inter-Korean tensions. Lee emphasized the blocked communication channels with Pyongyang, urging China to act as a peace mediator. Xi stressed the need for patience, while both leaders agreed on the importance of freezing North Korea's nuclear and missile programs.

title: Why Vijay’s final film Jana Nayagan is caught in a censor storm?
content: Jana Nayagan's January 9th release is in jeopardy due to censorship delays.  Despite prior clearance, the CBFC referred the film for review after a complaint, sparking a legal battle.  Producers argue the action is arbitrary, especially given the film's massive pre-release bookings and Vijay's impending political entry. The Madras High Court is now involved.

title: At 8.2% interest, how does SCSS compare to bank FDs, RBI bonds, mutual funds? Explained
content: The Senior Citizens Savings Scheme is a government-backed Post Office savings option designed for retirees and senior citizens. It offers a reliable stream of regular interest income, combining higher returns with low risk.

title: AIBE 20 result released on the website: Check details here
content: The Bar Council of India has declared the AIBE-XX results for the exam held on November 30, 2025, though the result link is yet to be activated. Out of 2,51,968 candidates, 1,74,386 have qualified, taking the overall pass percentage to 69.21 per cent after revisions to the answer key. Check the direct link to downlaod the AIBE 20 result.

title: Sargaalaya craft village, where  spirit of cultural integration permeates every stall

title: Chambliss pleads case, hopes NCAA OK's waiver

title: NFL futures: Seahawks enter playoffs as Super Bowl favorites, Rams right behind
content: The top two teams in the NFC West have the best odds to win the Super Bowl heading into the playoffs. The  Seattle Seahawks  are the favorites to win Super Bowl 60, following closely by the division rival  Los Angeles Rams . The AFC West-winning  Denver Broncos  have the third-best odds to win the Super Bowl as the top overall seed in the AFC. They, like the Seahawks, will have a bye in the first round. Here are the Super Bowl odds and conference championship odds for every team still in the hunt. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.

title: Offseason grades: Blue Jays make another splash by signing Japanese 3B Okamoto
